main event: On 6th February 1959, a civilian observed two very bright objects resembling silver mirrors hovering in the sky near Dinwiddie, Virginia. The objects were closer than high-flying aircraft's jet contrails and disappeared after a minute and a half.
interesting points: The observer, a civilian, described the objects as very bright and close in proximity, closer than the high-flying aircraft's contrails.
The objects were initially observed near high-flying aircraft with contrails, indicating they were at a significant altitude.
The observer estimated the distance of the objects to be far away, yet seemed closer than jet contrails, indicating the unusual nature of the sighting.
No conclusive explanation could be determined, as the data was insufficient for evaluation, leaving the nature of the objects unexplained.
The weather at the time of the sighting was reported as clear with good visibility, ruling out weather-related phenomena as the cause of the sighting.
sighted object: two very bright, silver mirror-like objects
witnesses: civilian, Mrs. (redacted) - housewife, and her husband - a former Air Force pilot
